page.title: 16Slindon Base Camp.
page.content: The Base Camp at Slindon is a new venture in the area, only recently begun by the National Trust. Their main object here is conservation, and to this end, young volunteers come to the camp for short periods and work with trained National Trust Foresters and other employees. They do conservation work for the National Tust within the forested areas, caring for new trees, planting new trees and ensuring that the wildlife,such as the herds of deer, is adequately protected. They work mainly under the guidance of Mr.John Nazareth, amongst others. Whilst they are at the camp,they live in a converted stable block which has all modern amenities.
